userContext.situation: Production engineer or line supervisor tasked with selecting or upgrading packaging equipment for a mayonnaise production line. They understand general packaging principles but need guidance on how mayonnaise's specific properties affect machine requirements.
userContext.currentState: Uncertain which filling system, sealing method, and machine configuration will best handle mayonnaise's high viscosity, air sensitivity, and emulsion stability requirements. May have experienced issues with current equipment (air pockets, inconsistent fill weights, emulsion breakdown).
userContext.desiredState: Confident understanding of how mayonnaise properties translate to specific machine requirements, enabling informed equipment selection that prevents product quality issues and optimizes production efficiency.

goldenInsights.insight: At shear rate of 100 s-1, mayonnaise emulsion structure is irreversibly damaged - explains why pump selection prevents permanent product damage
Traditional mayo yield stress (360 Pa) is 12x higher than low-fat (30 Pa) - different products need different machines
Nitrogen exclusion more effective than antioxidants for preventing rancidity
Piston pumps require cylinder grease that creates hygiene concerns for food - hidden trade-off with precision

opinionsIncluded: H2-1 (Mayonnaise Properties): Don't treat mayonnaise as 'just another viscous product' - its emulsion structure demands specific handling
H2-2 (Filling System): Rotary lobe pumps often outperform piston fillers despite lower accuracy specs due to hygiene and gentle handling
H2-3 (Temperature): Temperature control is non-negotiable - machines without pathway heating create ongoing operational problems
H2-4 (Air Incorporation): Nitrogen flushing more effective than antioxidants - 20-30% shelf life extension achievable
H2-5 (Packaging Format): PET with oxygen scavenger now matches glass performance at lower weight and cost
H2-6 (Sanitary Design): Don't underestimate CIP requirements - mayo's protein/fat content means more aggressive cleaning
